intro: Colax puydtii, commonly known as the Puydt's colax, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of its family. Colax puydtii is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
